moves.1. d4: I open with my queen pawn.
moves.2... dxc4: Black accepts the Queens Gambit. Rather unusual, I think it´s bad for Black.
moves.3. e4: Gaining space in the center. You shall always do that if Black accepts the Gambit!
moves.12... Ba6 13. g3 O-O-O: This move is to hazardous. Black castles queenside, too risky with removed pawns in front of the King! Not to recommend!
moves.14... Qb7 15. Bxc4: Gains a pawn! Now you can see the danger for Blacks King along the open c-file!
moves.16. Qd3: Was this retreat really necessary? When I look closer to the position, it seems like that I just could take the e-pawn there?
moves.18... Rc8: Threatens my queen, but misses something essential!
moves.19. Nxd7+: A discovered double-check! Wins a piece for free, but it will be worse for Black, much worse!
moves.19... Ka8 20. Nab6+: At first I didn´t saw this crushing move, but then I discovered it!
moves.20... Qxb6: Black must take with his queen!
moves.21. Qxc8+: But it doesn´t help Black! Mate in one, can you see it?
moves.22. Qxb8#:
I only takes the queen and now checkmate!
Immediately after I finished this amazing game I thinked, I must annotate this game! As I can see, Black castled in the wrong direction, if he had castled kingside I think it had been a whole different story!
